intro: Pomaderris commixta, commonly known as the variable pomaderris, is a shrub native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its small, oval-shaped leaves that are often hairy. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in clusters, typically in spring. It is adapted to a range of soil types but prefers well-drained conditions. Pomaderris commixta is often found in woodland and open forest habitats.
